name: Christian Konrad 0001
content: Christian Konrad Christian Konrad I am a Reader/Associate Professor in the School of Computer Science at the University of Bristol. I am the head of the Algorithms and Complexity research group. Research Interests: My main research interest is the design and the analysis of algorithms. I am particularly interested in algorithmic challenges that arise when processing massive data sets and the theory of distributed computing. Publications Google Scholar   DBLP Professional Service: Program Committees: STOC 2026, SWAT 2026, STACS 2020, ICALP (Track A) 2020 Communication Chair: PODC 2019 Conference Organization Committee: SWAT 2016 Projects: EPSRC New Investigator Award, Principal Investigator, "StreamDG: Streaming Processing of Massive Dynamic Graphs", 09/2021-08/2024, ~£250.000 General Research Fund (Hong Kong), Co-investigator, "Algorithmic Foundations of Distributed Large-Scale Graph Processing", 01/2021 - 12/2023, ~£80.000 CV: Before joining Bristol in April 2018, I spent 18 months as a research associate at the University of Warwick and three years as a postdoc at Reykjavik University. I obtained my PhD (2013) from the Université Paris Diderot and Université Paris-Sud under the supervision of Frédéric Magniez and my Masters degree (2008) from the Technical University of Munich.
